1. Content strategy:

Given the research findings, the content strategy would aim to educate and inspire furniture manufacturers, kitchen designers and installers on how to address the common issues of kitchen design and layout. The strategy would be a mix of educational content, inspiration galleries and product promotion, with the aim of positioning the company as a trusted partner in the industry.

To achieve customer engagement and acquisition, the content strategy would include the following elements:

* Educational blog posts and guides on how to design kitchens for optimal storage and layout
* Social media campaigns highlighting real-life examples of kitchen design and renovation
* An inspiration gallery featuring successful kitchen designs and renovations that have overcome common issues
* Email newsletters featuring product promotions, special offers and industry news
* Collaborations with influencers and industry experts to create engaging content and promote the brand

To coordinate resources, the company could allocate a content marketing budget and hire a content marketing manager to oversee the strategy. The marketing team could work closely with the product development team to ensure that all new products are showcased in the content strategy.

2. Content priorities:

In the first 90 days as a creative content manager, the priorities would be:

1. Conducting a content audit to identify existing content and its effectiveness
2. Creating a content calendar that aligns with the company’s marketing objectives and seasonal trends
3. Developing a content plan that includes blog posts, social media campaigns, email newsletters and influencer collaborations
4. Identifying key influencers and industry experts to collaborate with
5. Creating a content style guide to ensure consistency across all channels
6. Developing a reporting framework to measure the effectiveness of the content strategy
7. Coordinating with the product development team to ensure that new products are showcased in the content strategy.

By focusing on these priorities, the company can establish a strong content marketing foundation that will drive engagement and acquisition among their target audience.
